user.title: WashData Setup
user.description:
Configure your washing machine or other appliance.

Power sensor is required.

**Next, you will be asked if you want to create your first profile.**

data_description.name: A friendly name for this device (e.g., 'Washing Machine', 'Dishwasher').
data_description.device_type: What type of appliance is this? Helps tailor detection and labeling.
data_description.power_sensor: The sensor entity that reports real-time power consumption (in watts) from your smart plug.
data_description.min_power: Power readings above this threshold (in watts) indicate the appliance is running. Start with 2W for most devices.

first_profile.title: Create First Profile
first_profile.description:
A **Cycle** is a complete run of your appliance (e.g., a load of laundry). A **Profile** groups these cycles by type (e.g., 'Cotton', 'Quick Wash'). Creating a profile now helps the integration estimate duration immediately.

You can manually select this profile in the device controls if it's not detected automatically.

**Leave 'Profile Name' empty to skip this step.**

apply_suggestions.title: Copy Suggested Values

settings.title: Settings
settings.description: Tune detection thresholds, learning, and advanced behavior. Defaults work well for most setups.

data_description.device_type: Select the type of appliance (Washing Machine, Dryer, Dishwasher, Coffee Machine, Electric Vehicle). This tag is stored with each cycle for better organization.
data_description.power_sensor: The sensor entity reporting real-time power (in watts). You can change this anytime without losing historical data—useful if you replace a smart plug.
data_description.min_power: Power readings above this threshold (in watts) indicate the appliance is running. Start with 2W for most devices.
data_description.off_delay: Seconds the smoothed power must stay below the stop threshold to mark completion. Default: 120s.
data_description.notify_service: Home Assistant notify service to use (optional).
data_description.notify_events: Which events to send notifications for.
data_description.notify_before_end_minutes: Minutes before the estimated end of the cycle to trigger a notification. Set to 0 to disable. Default: 0.
data_description.notify_title: Custom title for notifications. Supports {device} placeholder.
data_description.notify_icon: Icon to use for notifications (e.g. mdi:washing-machine). Leave empty to use default.
data_description.notify_start_message: Message sent when a cycle starts. Supports {device} placeholder.
data_description.notify_finish_message: Message sent when a cycle finishes. Supports {device}, {duration}, {program} placeholders.
data_description.notify_pre_complete_message: Message sent before completion. Supports {device}, {minutes} placeholders.

advanced_settings.title: Advanced Settings
advanced_settings.description: Tune detection thresholds, learning, and advanced behavior. Defaults work well for most setups.

data.max_full_traces_per_profile: Retention: Max Full Traces per Profile

data_description.start_threshold_w: Power must rise ABOVE this threshold to START a cycle. Set higher than your standby power. Default: min_power + 1 W.
data_description.stop_threshold_w: Power must fall BELOW this threshold to END a cycle. Set just above zero to avoid noise triggering false ends. Default: 0.6 * min_power.
data_description.min_off_gap: If a cycle starts within this many seconds of the previous one ending, they will be MERGED into a single cycle.
data_description.start_duration_threshold: Ignore brief power spikes shorter than this duration (seconds). Filters out boot spikes (e.g., 60W for 2s) before real cycle starts. Default: 5s.
data_description.progress_reset_delay: After a cycle completes (100%), wait this many seconds of idle before resetting progress to 0%. Default: 300s.
data_description.no_update_active_timeout: For publish-on-change sensors: only force-end an ACTIVE cycle if no updates arrive for this many seconds. Low-power completion still uses the Off Delay.
data_description.sampling_interval: Minimum sampling interval in seconds. Updates faster than this rate will be ignored. Default: 2.0s.
data_description.auto_label_confidence: Automatically label cycles at or above this confidence on completion (0.0–1.0).
data_description.learning_confidence: Minimum confidence to request user verification via an event (0.0–1.0).
data_description.duration_tolerance: Tolerance for time-remaining estimates during a run (0.0–0.5 corresponds to 0–50%).
data_description.profile_match_interval: How often (in seconds) to attempt profile matching during a cycle. Lower values provide faster detection but use more CPU. Default: 300s (5 minutes).
data_description.profile_match_min_duration_ratio: Minimum duration ratio for profile matching. Running cycle must be at least this fraction of profile duration to match. Lower = earlier matching. Default: 0.50 (50%).
data_description.profile_match_max_duration_ratio: Maximum duration ratio for profile matching. Running cycle must not exceed this multiple of profile duration. Higher = more lenient. Default: 1.50 (150%).
data_description.smoothing_window: Number of recent power readings used for moving-average smoothing.
data_description.profile_match_threshold: Minimum DTW similarity score (0.0–1.0) required to consider a profile as a match. Higher = stricter matching, fewer false positives. Default: 0.4.
data_description.profile_unmatch_threshold: DTW similarity score (0.0–1.0) below which a previously matched profile is rejected. Should be lower than match threshold to prevent flickering. Default: 0.35.
data_description.profile_duration_tolerance: Tolerance used by profile matching for total duration variance (0.0–0.5). Default behavior: ±25%.
data_description.interrupted_min_seconds: Runs shorter than this may be classified as 'interrupted'.
data_description.abrupt_drop_watts: Absolute power drop (W) considered an abrupt cliff.
data_description.abrupt_drop_ratio: Relative drop ratio (0–1). Example: 0.6 means a 60% drop is abrupt.
data_description.abrupt_high_load_factor: Factor above baseline considered 'high load' before an abrupt drop (used with abrupt detection).
data_description.max_past_cycles: Total number of cycles to retain (oldest removed). Default: 200.
data_description.max_full_traces_per_profile: Number of recent labeled cycles to keep with full power traces per profile. Older traces are summarized via envelopes. Default: 20.
data_description.max_full_traces_unlabeled: Number of recent unlabeled cycles to keep with full power traces to support auto-labeling. Default: 20.
data_description.watchdog_interval: Seconds between watchdog checks while running. Default: 5s. WARNING: Ensure this is HIGHER than your sensor's update interval to avoid false stops (e.g., if sensor updates every 60s, use 65s+).
data_description.completion_min_seconds: Cycles shorter than this will be marked as 'interrupted' even if they finish naturally. Default: 600s.
data_description.notify_before_end_minutes: Minutes before the estimated end of the cycle to trigger a notification. Set to 0 to disable. Default: 0.
data_description.auto_tune_noise_events_threshold: Number of short/low-power 'noise' cycles within 24h needed to auto-adjust min_power. Default: 3.
data_description.running_dead_zone: After cycle starts, ignore power dips for this many seconds to prevent false end detection during initial spin-up phase. Set to 0 to disable. Default: 0s.
data_description.end_repeat_count: Number of times the end condition (power below threshold for off_delay) must be met consecutively before ending the cycle. Higher values prevent false ends during pauses. Default: 1.
data_description.start_energy_threshold: Cycle must accumulate at least this much energy (Wh) during the START phase to be confirmed. Default: 0.005 Wh.
data_description.end_energy_threshold: Cycle ends only if energy in the last Off-Delay window is below this value (Wh). Prevents false ends if power fluctuates near zero. Default: 0.05 Wh.
data_description.auto_maintenance: Enable nightly maintenance to repair samples, merge fragmented cycles, and keep storage healthy.
data_description.expose_debug_entities: Show advanced sensors (Confidence, Phase, Ambiguity) for debugging.
data_description.save_debug_traces: Store detailed ranking and power trace data in history (Increases storage usage).
data_description.dtw_bandwidth: Maximum allowed time warping (stretching) as a ratio of cycle duration. Higher values allow matching highly variable cycles (e.g., sensor-delayed phases) but increase CPU cost. Default: 0.20 (20%).
data_description.external_end_trigger_enabled: Enable monitoring of an external binary sensor to trigger cycle completion. When enabled, the sensor turning 'on' will immediately complete the current cycle.
data_description.external_end_trigger: Select a binary sensor entity. When this sensor turns 'on', the current cycle will end with status 'completed' (not 'interrupted').

post_process.title: Process History (Merge/Split)
post_process.description:
Clean up cycle history by merging fragmented runs and splitting incorrectly merged cycles within a time window. Enter number of hours to look back.
{info}

data_description.time_range:
Number of hours to scan for fragmented cycles to merge. Use 999999 to process all historical data.
{info}
data_description.gap_seconds: Threshold to decide split vs merge. Gaps SHORTER than this are merged. Gaps LONGER than this are split. Lower this to force a split on a cycle that was merged incorrectly.

cleanup_profile.title: Clean Up History - Select Profile
cleanup_profile.description: Select a profile to visualize. This will generate a graph showing all past cycles for this profile to help identify outliers.

cleanup_select.title: Clean Up History - Graph & Delete
cleanup_select.description:
![Graph]({graph_url})

**Visualizing {profile_name}**

The graph shows individual cycles as colored lines. Identify outliers (lines far from the group) and matching their color in the list below to delete them.

**Select cycles to PERMANENTLY delete:**

interactive_editor.title: Merge/Split Interactive Editor
interactive_editor.description: Select a manual action to perform on your cycle history.

editor_split_params.title: Split Configuration
editor_split_params.description: Adjust the sensitivity for splitting this cycle. Any idle gap longer than this will cause a split.

reprocess_history.title: Maintenance: Reprocess & Optimize Data
reprocess_history.description:
Performs deep cleaning of historical data:
1. Trims zero-power readings (silence).
2. Fixes cycle timing/duration.
3. Recalculates all statistical models (envelopes).

**Run this to fix data issues or apply new algorithms.**

wipe_history.title: Wipe History (Testing Only)
wipe_history.description: ⚠️ This will permanently delete ALL stored cycles and profiles for this device. This cannot be undone!

export_import.title: Export/Import JSON
export_import.description: Copy/paste cycles, profiles, AND settings for this device. Export below or paste JSON to import.

data_description.mode: Choose Export to copy current data and settings, or Import to paste exported data from another WashData device.
data_description.json_payload: For Export: copy this JSON (includes cycles, profiles, and all fine-tuned settings). For Import: paste JSON exported from WashData.
